results.name: Negative part of inverse of A117966; write -n in balanced ternary and then replace (-1)'s with 2's.
reference: D. E. Knuth, The Art of Computer Programming. Addison-Wesley, Reading, MA, Vol. 2, pp. 173-175
link: Indranil Ghosh, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..6561
Ken Levasseur, The Balanced Ternary Number System
example: -7 in balanced ternary is (-1)1(-1), changing to 212 ternary is 23, so a(7)=23.
program: print([a(n) for n in range(1, 101)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jun 06 2017
xref: Cf. A117966. a(n) = A004488(A117967(n)). Bisection of A140263. A140268 gives the same sequence in ternary.
